name: Mission to the Slavs
summary: The Mission to the Slavs was undertaken by the brothers Cyril and Methodius, who were sent by the Byzantine Emperor to evangelize the Slavic peoples of Moravia. They created the Glagolitic alphabet and translated the Bible and liturgical texts into Old Church Slavonic. Their work laid the foundation for Slavic Christianity and culture, though they faced opposition from German bishops who preferred Latin.

name: Photian Schism
summary: The Photian Schism was a conflict between Pope Nicholas I and Photius, Patriarch of Constantinople, from 863 to 867. The dispute arose over Photius's appointment as patriarch and his criticism of Western practices, particularly the Filioque clause. Although the schism was eventually resolved, it highlighted growing tensions between the Eastern and Western Churches that would eventually lead to the Great Schism of 1054.
